name: Google Shopping Connector
description: Connector service that sends mapped product data from Salsify to Google Shopping (Merchant or Manufacturer) via direct push to Google's FTP/SFTP or API. Only Google Merchant supports API publish. Deployed on Kubernetes.

name: Google Merchant Center
description: Google's platform for managing product data feeds for Google Shopping ads and free listings. The con-google-shopping connector publishes product data to GMC via API or FTP/SFTP.

name: Google Shopping Merchant
description: Channel type in Salsify for publishing product data to Google Merchant Center. Supports both FTP/SFTP and API delivery methods. Uses the Google Shopping Connector service.

name: Google Shopping Manufacturer
description: Channel type in Salsify for publishing product data to Google Manufacturer Center. Uses FTP/SFTP for delivery (pull-based instead of direct push). Legacy approach still used by some customers.

name: Connector Integration Checklist
description: A standardized checklist/framework used to document connector capabilities and configurations. Includes categories like transmission method, payload format, data schema, schema updates, response feedback, async feedback, human review, dry run support, image delivery, business rules, update model, and bulk support.

name: Tab-Separated Values
description: A file format used by the Google Shopping connector to serialize product data for publishing. The TSV serializer supports publishing variant information to Google.
